title: Cyber Attack ROE Compliance
description: A cyber commander must verify that a proposed cyberattack against an adversary's infrastructure complies with the Law of Armed Conflict and specific ROE.

tasks.description: Input the details of the proposed cyberattack, including the target (e.g., power grid) and the intended effect (e.g., temporary disruption).
tasks.expected_outcome: Commander accurately enters the proposed cyber operation parameters.

tasks.description: Assess the potential for second-order effects on the civilian population (e.g., impact on hospitals).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent correctly identifies potential collateral effects that must be mitigated.

tasks.description: Query the ROE database and confirm that the attack is permissible as it is temporary, reversible, and avoids protected civilian infrastructure.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent provides a clear 'go/no-go' recommendation based on a correct interpretation of the ROE.
